alert.note: Alert for Jenkins; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND JENKINS COUNTIES... At 247 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Herndon, or 11 miles southwest of Waynesboro, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and increased chance of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Hiltonia, Perkins, Millhaven, Herndon, Burtons Ferry Landing and Hilltonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
